solution_line_template: The cost of a slice of cake is ${milk_tea_cost} x {cake_cost_fraction} = $<<{milk_tea_cost}*{cake_cost_fraction}={slice_cake_cost}>>{slice_cake_cost}.
So, {num_cake_slices} slices of cake cost ${slice_cake_cost} x {num_cake_slices} = $<<{num_cake_slices}*{slice_cake_cost}={two_slices_cake_cost}>>{two_slices_cake_cost}.
Therefore, {num_cake_slices} slices of cake and 1 cup of milk tea cost ${two_slices_cake_cost} + ${milk_tea_cost} = ${total_cost}.
